result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Todd M Buelow was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence presently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Pay fine/costs. To be paid during period of inprisonment with balance to be paid on extended supervision.   25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Not eligible for challenge incarceration program.
Eligible for substance abuse program.
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

DOT/AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment

Sentencing

Defendant Todd M Buelow in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Todd M Buelow in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:34 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court received the original PSI Jan 30th and an amended Feb 4th.
State received a copy of the PSI.
Atty Drengler received a copy of the amended version this morning.

Court also received a sentencing memorandum yesterday about 4 pm, did read it.
State received a copy of this  as well.

Atty Drengler has no corrections on the amended PSI.
Atty Drengler states there is no reason why his client should not be sentenced today.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court believes a prison sentence is appropriate.

BY THE COURT: 
Determinate Prison Sentence for 5 Years, 0 Months,  Consecutive to any sentence Defendant is presently serving now
Initial Confinement for 2 Years 
Extended Supervision for 3 Years
Not eligible for challenge incarceration program
Eligible for substance abuse program
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $1,500 plus costs 
Pay a blood draw fee of $26.45
To be paid during period of inprisonment, 25% out of prison account
Balance to be paid on extended supervision
36 Month Revocation retroactive to any administrative suspension
36 Month IID effective TODAY
DOT/AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment 
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances  
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license

Appeal rights are addressed.

Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to be returned to the Wisconsin State Prison.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Sentencing hearing on February 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Todd M Buelow in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Todd M Buelow in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:35 p.m. Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Defendant agrees this will result in his 6th conviction for OWI. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty count 1 - OWI 6th offense.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed. 
Court orders PSI. 
Bond Continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Todd M Buelow in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. Defendant Todd M Buelow in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Pleas are entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT: Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
